page.title: 05THE CHURCH TODAY IN NEWICK
page.content: The Church realises its importance in a small, village community. It provides a sense of continuity and stability in an ever-changing world. Talking to the Deaconess made us realise that everyone in the village needs the church to be there _ even though they themselves do not take an active part in its life. The Church has tried to keep a balance of tradition for the older parishioners, and new ideas to attract the young people. The Parish Church has tried to forge links between other religious groups, with varying degrees of success. Some refuse to find any common ground whereas the Catholics, with no hall of their own, borrow the Parish one, which makes for frequent, healthy contact.
